remarks: Obtain an independent vector set ` U , X , Y ` from a vector ` U ` dependent on ` X ` and ` Z ` and another independent set ` Z , X , Y ` .  (Here we don't show the ` ( N `` { X } ) =/= ( N `` { Y } ) ` part of the independence, which passes straight through.  We also don't show nonzero vector requirements that are redundant for this theorem.  Different orderings can be obtained using ~ lspexch and ~ prcom .)  (Contributed by NM, 4-May-2015.)
statement:
lspindp5.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lspindp5.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` W ) $.
lspindp5.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lspindp5.y $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lspindp5.x $e |- ( ph -> Y e. V ) $.
lspindp5.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. V ) $.
lspindp5.e $e |- ( ph -> Z e. ( N ` { X , U } ) ) $.
lspindp5.m $e |- ( ph -> -. Z e. ( N ` { X , Y } ) ) $.
lspindp5 $p |- ( ph -> -. U e. ( N ` { X , Y } ) ) $.
